results.title: Once were warriors
results.creator_credit: Robin Scholes, Communicado, New Zealand Film Commission, Avalon Studios, New Zealand On Air and Lee Tamahori
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Duff’s controversial best seller, “Once Were Warriors” is an intense and powerful film that leaves audiences stunned with its uncompromising insight into the strength of Maori culture in the face of degrading urban ghettos and devastating family violence. Jake (Temuera Morrison) and Beth (Rena Owen) have been married 18 years and she still finds him irresistible. Jake is a muscular, handsome man who exudes an explosive sexual energy but spends most of the time at the pub, often proving his masculinity with his fists and regularly exploding into rages that leave terrible scars on Beth and their family.

results.title: Once upon Australia. River red
results.creator_credit: Klaus Toft, ABC-TV (Australia) and Nicholas Hilligoss
results.brief_description: ‘Once upon Australia’ examines our dinosaur past, vividly recreating giant goannas and marsupials using animation. This is a world where humans have little or no part. ‘River Red’ profiles the natural environment of one of Australia’s best known trees, the River Red Gum.

results.title: Once upon a wilderness
results.brief_description: Passages from an early pioneer’s journal illustrate the contrast between the American wilderness then, and the environment today. Shows how the wilderness is being decimated by construction and “progress”, often without thought. Emphasises the importance of attitudes. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Once upon a time, cinema [NTSC] = Nassereddin Shah, actor-e cinema
results.creator_credit: Masud Jafari Jozani and Mohsen Makhmalbaf
results.brief_description: Once again Iranian director Mohsen Makhmalbaf (The Marriage of the blessed, Gabbeh, Kandahar) has created an extraordinary piece of cinema with his tenth feature and first comedy. “Once upon a time, cinema” reflects on the history of Iranian cinema through the eyes of a Charlie Chaplin look-alike cinematographer whose main object in life is to bring the magic and fantasy of cinema to the Shah and his Persian court during the Qajar dynasty. Using excerpts from classic Iranian films, including “Gheisar (1969), “Still life” (1974), “Downpour” (1971) intercut with contemporary black and white footage, Makhmalbaf beautifully intertwines cinematic themes and genres from slapstick, melodrama and adventure to fantasy, surrealism and realism. The characters in the story consist of an eclectic mix, sometimes bordering on the bizarre, which only adds to the surreal tone of this intriguing and fascinating film. Cast includes Ezzatollah Entezami, Mahdi Hashemi, Mohammad Ali Keshavarz, Akbar Abdi, Dariush Arjomand, Faremah Motamed-Aria. (Awards: Istanbul; Karlovy Vary) In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time, Beirut = Kan ya makan Beirut
results.creator_credit: Balcon Productions, Aleph Productions and Jocelyne Saab
results.brief_description: Two young women, distraught over the destruction of Beirut and curious to get beneath the romantic, mythical stereotypes of the city in its heyday, visit a reclusive and eccentric film collector. In an abandoned theatre they mine his huge archive of films, entering a vast cinematic history of Beirut from the silent era, through the French-directed films of the 1930s, films of the 1960s by Arab filmmakers, to the large scale American studio films of the 1970s. Drawing on hundreds of excerpts, Saab portrays the cinematic fantasies of Beirut that proliferated in the prewar era. From temptresses to spies to villains, Beirut was a playground in which consistently fantastic narratives took place. The two young women literally enter these films. Appearing as characters in scenes they comment on the narratives from a contemporary perspective, attempting to reconcile this imagery with the war-savaged Beirut of today. A historical mapping of the cinematic landscape of Lebanon that reveals an explicit interest in memory, ‘Once Upon a Time, Beirut’ actively seeks to understand how media representations have manipulated the identity of this complex city. In French and Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in the west = C'era una volta il West [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Fulvio Morsella, Paramount Pictures, Rafran, San Marco and Sergio Leone
results.brief_description: Leone took classic themes of the western revenge story and the coming to the Frontier of civilisation in the form of the railroad and reshaped them into a fresco-like narrative neither revisionist nor traditional. Western stereotypes are abstracted in a West so self-consciously relocated in fable and fantasy that it has been suggested by David Thomson that Leone at heart harboured a contempt for the genre. He and his writers certainly brought European sensibility to bear on American classicism frequently citing classic Hollywood westerns while dilating time and lingering on atmospherics at the expense of cause and effect, clarity and classical economy. Essential to the film’s affect is a symmetry between image and music (Morricone’s four basic musical themes were used to pace and construct scenes throughout the shooting) in an operatic “dance of death” in which “the arias are not sung, they are stared”. Cast includes Claudia Cardinale, Henry Fonda, Jason Robards, Charles Bronson and Gabriele Ferzetti.

results.title: Once upon a time in China III
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ng See Yuen
results.brief_description: The third adventure sees martial arts champion Jet Lee journey to Beijing to visit his father who runs a medicine factory. He arrives on the eve of the Lion Dance martial arts festival where rival factions are stirring up trouble. Once he enters the contest, things really heat up and non-stop action and amazing feats of strength and skill are the result. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in China II
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Film Workshop and Tsui Hark
results.brief_description: Although not as bleak as the first in the series, the conflict between cultures and the rapidly changing values of the late 19th. century is the theme of this martial arts film starring asian champion Jet Lee. He clings to tradition in a China weakened by the invasion of imperialist forces while others like Sun Yat-Sen adapt to the change. There is plenty of hair-raising action and the final showdown in the Temple of the White Lotus will amaze. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in China (Restored version) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Film Workshop and Tsui Hark
results.brief_description: The first of one of the classic Kung Fu films starring champion Jet Li as legendary martial arts folk hero, Wong Fei Hung. Set in a time when foreign traders and Jesuit priests were beginning to enter China, Wong Fei Hung leads the Black Army, a local militia determined to protect the town against the evil forces which operate in it. An action film which will amaze and astound as Jet Li performs a series of heroic feats, defeating any evil in his path. Restored widescreen version containing over 10 minutes of footage previously not included on video. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.
